result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory K. Meyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory K. Meyer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Gregory K. Meyer
Current: 113 S. 2nd Ave., Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 10-05-2015)
Prior: 28 N. Brown Street #216, Rhinelander, WI 54501

10:05 a.m. Attorney John E Voorhees in court. Defendant does not appear. Steven Michlig, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 15CM183, 15CM259, 15FO521. Voorhees statement to defendant's non-appearance--defendant discharged from St. Mary's on Friday; he may not have housing--Voorhees believes he may be at Salvation Army in Wausau. Michlig requests warrant. Court authorizes warrant as previously ordered. 10:28 a.m. back on record. Counsel present, defendant now appears. Plea questionnaire & waiver filed. Voorhees speaks to agreement. State moves to dismiss 15CM183 but read in; granted by the Court. State moves to dismiss 15FO521; granted by the Court. Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1 in 15CM185 and Ct. 1 in 15CM259. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Voorhees/Court statement to sentencing. The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4). Warrants quashed, not yet issued.
